author: megan

review: Amazon did a great job on this product and kudos for the awesome IOS remote control app. After a few days of usage, I prefer the Fire TV stick over my Chromecast. It's very easy to use and has an intuitive interface. It has all the apps that I generally want to use (Prime, Netflix, lots of News options and Spotify). The remote is great as well. In contrast to Chromecast I like that I don't need to first load up an app on my iphone/ipad before "casting" to the TV; this cuts out alot of the bugginess you can get in that scenario (ie. netflix on ipad not registering that the chromecast is connected, yet it's playing a netflix stream... that sort of thing).
author: Adam

review: I was hoping to find something superior to Apple TV or Chromecast.  Probably not worse, but, certainly not better. I can't find a good "mirroring" app for ipad.  I thought that it might be better than Roku or Apple TV for working with Slingbox, but, mirroring would be the only solution, and I haven't found a mirroring app for this yet.  Roku is better at Slingbox.  Fire TV is better with Prime Movies and TV.  Its worth $39, but, its largely redundant without much to offer if you have one of the other streaming devices.  If tv's had unlimited HDMI ports, it would justify a permanent place, but, it looks like the Apple TV will be connected most of the time unless the only way to watch a program is on Prime.
author: Hoovermom "Debbie Starner"

review: Traded in my Roku 2 for this, I LOVE the Fire stick. Much better user interface, low profile, very easy to use. I recommend this whole heartily over the Roku.It does slow down in bits, but I certainly can't fault it for that.
